Dancing Dreams

Music blaring, people screaming,
Ground shaking, cell phones beeping.
It's chaos to say the least, like hordes of angry ants
But such is the scene, at any high school dance.

She walks through the doors, no one makes a sound,
The guys just stare, the girls jealousy's abound.
The beauty of the school she is, and more so tonight,
Her jet black dress shimmers as she steps into the light.

Murmurs fall over the crowd,
Boys that wish they had come with that girl.
Girlfriends hear, their voices too loud,
Countless slaps sends the guys for a whirl.

I step towards the shimmering beauty,
Having no partner of my own,
I ask her for a dance, she doesn't answer,
I give a silent moan.

She looks at me with that look,
Saying "I like you and you like me"
She can read me like a book,
My feelings she can see.

All eyes are on us, as I lead her to the floor,
As if on cue, there's silence, a love song starts.
I hold her in my arms, like we've been here before,
There is but one sound, the beating of our hearts.

A poem for you

You take my breath away,
The way you look and what you say,
Your whole being is a sweet elixir,
The joys of the world thrown into a mixer,
Your eyes, those gorgeous deep blue eyes,
Sets my heart on fire, makes my soul arise,
Your smile, though you hide it so,
Puts an end to sadness, fear and woe,
For all these things, for all you are,
You complete the world, from near to far.

Untitled

How can I feel this way?
How can I laugh at all you say?
It's not normal how I feel, I know it's not right,
How can I feel this way about someone I met on this site?

We first talked with a joke, and a flirtatious mood,
You weren't like the others, not slutty or rude,
You first opened up to me, then I to you,
Now you're my shoulder to cry on, my friend to turn to

I don't think this is love, in fact I know it's not,
Love comes and goes, can be stolen or bought,
This is something truer, something more strong,
That makes me know that it can't be wrong.

Two birds of a feather are we,
Two fruit fallen from the same tree,
You can bring out the best in me,
Make me strive to be all I can be.

(Why is it untitled? Because I can't think of a word to sum all this up)

Winter Wonderland

I sit up in bed and I let out a yawn,
Mornings too early, too close to the dawn.

First a sigh,
then a stretch,
And then a small "woah"
As I look out my window to the fresh fallen snow.

I throw on my coat and I run out the door,
And I almost slip on this new icy floor,
I look up with awe at this wonder above,
Snowflakes falling like a thousand white doves.

They fall with purpose and they fall with grace,
The eighth wonder of the world, their soft white face,
I tilt back my head and I part open my lips,
And I taste the magic in those little ice chips.

If ever there was a fairy tale land
A place from the carols, a real wonderland
A place of fun, of laughter and joy,
A place of excitement for each girl and boy.

Then that place is here, among the icy trees,
Where snowflakes fall and icicles freeze,
Where snowballs are thrown, and troubles melt,
The greatest feelings that you have ever felt.

Hope

Hope is a dream,

A dream that all your toils and tears will not be in vain,
That whatever comes by will be worth all your pain
A dream that tomorrow may be better than today,
But knowing there is a chance it will be this way.

Year in Review

The Canadian dollar rose and fell,
We saw the market go to hell,
The First Black Pres' of the United States,
Who some people love, and some people hates.

The Patriots have the perfect year,
18-0, a team without fear,
Manning and the Giants roll into town,
And turn their smile, into one big frown.

Sarah Palin watching Alaska from her porch,
Heath Ledger takes up the Joker's torch,
His promising life coming to an abrupt stop,
Ending before he could reach the top

2008 has been a rush of a year,
It's hard to believe it's no longer here,
The great moments, the bad,
The happy, the sad,

But that's all done, it's in the past,
Forget the fact it happened so fast,
Let's start this year now, let's not wait,
Let's make 2009, the new 2008

Light and Dark

Nuclear warfare, death by a gun,
Father lies dead, kid starts to run,
The world is rapidly reaching it's end,
No time to heal, no time to mend,

I look around and see chaos about me,
Destruction and death is all I can see,
Stock market crashes, poverty galore,
Still the greedy shout more, more, and more!

I look a little farther and see a bright light,
This must be the end, coming closer in sight,
Then it hits me, like the edge of a knife,
It's you that is the light of my life.

The world is a mess, a burning black hole,
Corrupts the mind, and darkens the soul,
But I have you to keep me in the light,
Shimmering like gold, purity and white.

Romance

I remember days of joy, and nights of love,
You were an angel, a gift from above,
Seeing you was like a breath of life,
A life of wonder, free from all strife.

I loved you then, and I love you now,
How it happened so fast I'll never know how,
You came like a song, and left like a breeze,
Never has there been sad times like these.

My first true love, my heart's delight,
You took out the dark and showed me the bright,
Days lasted forever, when all was right,
Day was gone when you left, and in came the night.

Caring (or lack thereof)

I don't care about what's right or what's wrong,
I don't care if the world thinks I've gone mad,
I don't care about the short or the long,
I don't care for the happy or the sad.

It may sound mean, it may sound obtuse,
You may think I have a few screws loose,
But I'll tell you this, with all of my heart,
I care for you, and pray we never part.

Soaring Wings

With my wings spread wide I stand,
Ready to jump, ready to fly,
Soar away to some distant land,
Wanting to go, but wanting to cry.

The wide world scares me,
I don't know what's outside,
I'm scared by all I see,
It makes me want to hide.

But I know that I have to leave,
I know that I have to soar,
Spread my wings and heave
Myself right out that door.

I want freedom without care,
I want life without despair.

Storm

The sky fills with clouds,
The world turns to gray,
I can feel darkness rain down upon me,
Like water that burns the flesh,
My soul becomes a vapor,
My body becomes a shell,
This hellish hole that I'm living in,
Is finally taking it's toll.

I close my eyes...
Are my eyes still there? I cannot feel them...
I close what should be my eyes,
Because I know this isn't the end,
I know, however that it's close,
One more day until we're done,
One more day before the storm.

Devil in Red

I walked into the room,
Fog filled my sight,
I could barely see my hand,
No vision and no light.

Through the darkness, through the mist,
She stood out like a flame,
The body of an angel, the soul of a devil,
I heard her speak my name.

Her voice was filled with lust,
Her smile filled with love,
Which heaven do I trust?
Hell below or up above?

I don't remember moving,
Yet somehow I was there,
Staring at the fire red dress,
Do I speak? Do I dare?

Before I could open my mouth,
She had it occupied,
Her scarlet lips surrounded mine,
As she worked her way inside.

As soon as it started it was done,
And she whispered in my ear,
"Dance with me my love,
show me why you're here"

I wrapped my hands around her waist,
Around that silky dress,
Devil or angel I didn't care,
She was still a goddess.

I can't dance with the devil,
I just can't stand the heat,
But when I look into her eyes,
My heart begins to beat.

I'm filled with fire I didn't know was there
When I look into her eyes, her lips, her hair.
She possesses me like a real devil would,
But melts my heart like a real angel could.

Restless Passions: Chapter One

*BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP*
Alyssa leaned over and slammed the snooze button
It's...way...too....early...
Looking over at her bedside digital clock, she saw with dismay that it was 8:30.
OK...maybe it's not so early after all
Accustomed to sleeping in until 11-12 for the past couple months, even 8:30 seemed early to her. She grudgingly crawled out of bed and into the bathroom, grabbing some shampoo she stepped into the shower.

The hot water fell on her body like tiny knives making their way onto her skin. It was invigorating, yet painful; awakening, yet excruciating. She had to have this hot of a shower though, otherwise she'd never wake up.

After the hot water had run on her for a few minutes, she slowly began to wake up. She looked down at the shampoo she had grabbed, and it was Ben's.
Why is Ben's shampoo in my house?
Then it hit her.

It wasn't her house...

It was theirs.

It still took a little getting used too, they had only been living together for a little less than a month. Alyssa had been unemployed for quite some time now, and it was taking it's toll on her savings. She wasn't able to pay for her rent anymore, and Ben, being the dear that he is, offered her a room at his house.

They hadn't been dating that long, only a few months, but Ben still let her come and live with him. Of course they weren't sleeping in the same bed yet, they hadn't had sex already so it would make things a little awkward. So Ben made up the spare bedroom, he had to be the only person his age to have a spare bedroom. Ben was young, only 22, but he had gotten a great job at a small restaurant that had started up. He became manager in a few years and then the restaurant opened up another branch, and then another, and another. Before you knew it he was regional manager and had a very, VERY nice house.

As she was recollecting all of this, she realized the reason why she had to wake up in the first place...her job interview!

She quickly soaped up her body, shampooed her silky red hair, which was losing it's silkiness because...well she didn't bother to care for it that much anymore. She stepped out of the shower and the shower mat flew out from under her and she ended up with her butt on the tile floor.

With a fair amount of pain, she got to her feet, it felt like she bruised her tailbone or something, but that didn't matter now, she had to get to her interview!

She ran to her closet, picked out the first suit and tie she saw, threw them on, ran to the bathroom, put her hair up in a bun, decided against putting on makeup, she just didn't have time.

Running downstairs to the door, she saw Ben just coming out of his bedroom. She gave him a running peck on the cheek.

"Hi hun, bye hun" she said as she whipped past him. She ran to the door, pushed it and...it stayed closed. She pushed again, it stayed closed...
She checked the deadbolt, it wasn't locked, she pushed again...
It stayed closed.

"BEEEEEEENNN!!" she screamed at the top of her lungs, she needed out, now. "WHY ISN'T THE.."

"It's a pull door sweetheart."

She pulled on the door and: lo and behold, it opened.
Feeling rather foolish, she continued her marathon, sprinting to the car, fumbling for her keys, jamming them in the ignition, and...she was off. She looked at the time, it was 8:51, she was going to make it.

____________________________________

Ben watched from out his window as the little white Cavalier drove down the street at top speed. His face was still warm from where Alyssa kissed him, he knew that there was no way it would still be warm, but he felt it anyways.

He felt like that a lot with her, whenever he was with her he felt some sort of wonder. He knew that they haven't known each other that long, but there was something about her, something special...and incredible.

That's why it wasn't awkward asking her to move in with him after 3 months and 11 days, simply because it was her.

He walked down the stairs and made his way into the kitchen, reaching into his cabinet and grabbed a few slices of bread and the toaster. It wasn't an extravagant breakfast by any means, but he was around extravagant food all day, he needs a break from it. So therefore his breakfasts are plain, toast and/or cereal.

After the bread had been in the toaster a few minutes, he heard the doorbell ring.
Oh no, what did Alyssa forget?

He walked to the door and opened it, giving his best "annoyed boyfriend" impression he sighed, looked away and asked.

"What do you need?"

"Well, a place to stay would be nice" a man's voice replied.

In shock, Ben looked only to see his little brother standing there with some luggage and a dejected look on his face.

The smell of burnt toast filled his nose.

Restless Passions: Chapter Four

BEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEP

Alyssa jumped back as her horn honked at her, I guess that's what you have to expect when you slam your head against your steering wheel though.

It had been an excruciating day, sitting there in that crappy leather chair listening to some lady blabber on and on about divorce and sentencing and blah blah blah blah blah. She was simply honest with her, she didn't know any of it.

She remembers it quite vividly actually, as she was quite honestly, a little proud of it.

She leaned onto the interviewers desk, looked around the office for a few seconds, then leaned in close to her and said:

"Let me tell you something" motioning for her to come closer, and when the interviewer did, she whispered in her ear "I don't know shit about law"

The look on the lady's face was worth the 4 hours she sat waiting to be called, her pink wired glasses almost falling off her pointed nose as her jaw dropped down to her President Bush mousepad...you'd think some people had never heard the word "shit" before.

But now she was just tired, the day of sitting and doing...well nothing, had taken it's toll on her. She just wanted to go crawl back into bed...

I think this unemployed-ness is making me lazy...sleeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeep

She got out of her car and walked into the house, throwing her keys onto the kitchen table she opened the fridge to find something to eat. Having skipped breakfast and not had time for any other food she was absolutely starved.

The fridge was well-stocked, Ben made enough money that he was able to not only have this really nice house, but have a lot of food to pick from at any time. She was trying to decide between having some leftover Chinese food from the other night...or just having some cheesecake.

Suddenly she heard footsteps in the other room, they sounded like they were coming from the living room. Alyssa's mind suddenly pictured a thief rummaging through the room stealing DVD's, CD's, and maybe even the TV! She looked around the kitchen for something she could use as a weapon, her eyes were drawn to one of the frying pans hanging over the oven.

She gripped is tightly in her hands, which she noticed had begun to sweat, and her breathing was growing more rapid too. She pressed on though, inching her way to the door, and upon arrival, pinned herself up against the wall.

She contemplated what to do, she could either run into the room like a mad woman swinging the pan around hoping to connect with skull. Or she could slowly open the door, sneak up on him and hit him in the head from behind. She could throw the pan at him, but that wouldn't do much good, it would have to be a knife or something...

Just then the door opened.

The mystery man walked into the kitchen and Alyssa, panicking, swung the frying pan at his face, knocking him to the ground. His head bounced as it hit the kitchen tile, and as it returned to the floor, she noticed that he didn't really look like a criminal at all...

He was clean shaven, his hair looked well-kept, his clothes were OK, they weren't high fashion by any means...but they were OK.

What is this guy doing in my house?

Just then she heard the front door open.

"Honey I'm home!"

Alyssa recognized Ben's voice, he had been saying that when he came in the door ever since they moved in. He either thinks it's funny or cute, either way it had gotten annoying. And now was really not the time to be cute.

"In the kitchen, come in here now!" she screamed, as she stood over this strange man, still confused as to what he was doing in the house...

As Ben entered the room, he immediately saw the man sprawled out over the black and white tile. Surprisingly, he ran to his side and started slapping his face

"Ryan? Ryan! Can you hear me? What happened to him?"

Alyssa was at a loss for what to say, it looked like this is a friend of his, and she really doubted he wanted to hear that she clunked him in the head with a pan.

"I think he...slammed his head on one of those pans hanging over the oven...really hard...do you know him?"

"Of course I know him," Ben replied "He's my brother."

The car

All your life you are driven around,
Given places to go, people to see,
You sit in the back and don't make a sound,
A seatbelt keeps you from being free.

You stare out the window and dream of power,
To use and control this amazing car.
In the driver's seat you sit down and cower,
Ready to drive, and drive away far.

And then you're back,
Your mom's at the wheel,
Knowing not how,
Real power would feel.

One day you'll get your chance to take the road,
Follow your dreams by not following the fold,
But now the seatbelt feels like a heavy load,
Not your life to live, not your world to mold.

Restless Passions: Chapter 5

Ryan had an odd feeling that he was in the air...he was too tired to open his eyes and look, but something told him that he wasn't on the ground. He suddenly realized that his head hurt...a lot.

"Put him down gently" said a mans voice
"I'm trying, he's heavy!" replied a womans

That's when Ryan began to remember things...he remembered walking into a strange house, being greeted by someone he recognized...his brother? So that's who the male voice was.
He was walking around this house, putting his luggage in a room he assumed was his. Then he remembers walking through a door and then...nothing.
Who is that woman?

He then felt himself land on something very hard

"You missed the couch! OK, let's try this again, this time, be very careful, and....DON'T DROP THAT ON HIS...."

--------------------------------------------------------2 hours later------------------------------------------------------------------

Ryan woke up.
He was in a bed this time, opening his eyes he could see a blanket laid over him. Looking around the room he realized that this must be the room that he was put in, there was really nothing else besides a bed. The walls were painted a dull off-white, there was a mirror hanging lonely on the wall opposite his bed. Beside his bed was a chair, and in the chair was...a woman.

Ryan quickly sat up in surprise, and that caused the woman to look up from her newspaper and rush to his side. She put her hand on his shoulder and forced him to lie down again.

"Good you're awake, we were worried about you." said the mystery woman, she put her hand on his forehead which stung him a little.
"Oh that still hurts does it?" she said, whoever she was she seems to know what happened. "I'm sorry about that, I came in the house and I heard strange footsteps, I thought you were a robber or something."

Ryan sat up again, much to the chagrin of the mystery woman, but he was determined to find out what was going on. Starting with the basics, he asked,

"Who are you?"

"I'm Alyssa" she replied as if he should know who that is, "Ben's girlfriend?...Does he tell you anything?"

"Well we haven't really talked in a while," Ryan said, realizing just how long it has been since him and Ben touched base, he didn't even know he had a girlfriend "I've been...busy" he added, hoping to add some justification to his absence.

"Yeah he hasn't really mentioned you much Ryan, do you have a job? A girlfriend?" asked Alyssa, who was making it painfully obvious that Ben and Ryan really knew nothing about each other

"No on both accounts, well I am starting a new job tomorrow, so we'll see how that goes." and Alyssa now knew as much about Ryan's life right now as his own brother did.

"Really? A cute guy like you doesn't have a girlfriend?"

...is she hitting on me? It's been so long since I've had a girlfriend I can't really tell...Oh wait how long am I taking to answer? Is this getting awkward? Maybe I should say something...

Before things got too awkward, Ben walked in the room

"Ryan! Oh thank God you're OK! I was getting worried sick about you. I take it you and Alyssa have already met." said Ben as he ran to the side of the bed.

"Yeah we have, I can't believe I didn't know you were dating someone!"

Ben put his arm around Alyssa and Ryan felt a hint of jealousy for a second, he didn't know why, and he didn't know just how much that would cost him later on.

Lady In Red

She walks into a room,
People know that she's there,
With her tight red dress,
And her silky black hair.

Every girl wants to be her,
As they give the jealous stare,
Every guy simply wants her,
But they wouldn't speak on a dare.

She surveys the room,
In her sexy, sultry way,
As she walks towards you,
You don't know what to say.

She takes your hand,
Leads you out on the floor,
Whispers soft to your ear,
She says, "I want some more"

The rest of the night flies,
A night of passion and of love,
She was the instincts of a tiger,
Mixed with the beauty of a dove.

You awake the next morning,
To find that she's not there,
You wonder where you wallet is...
And then you realize where.

You see now that your lady in red,
Came to you and lied,
That the face of an angel,
Hid the devil inside.

Do You Know?

Do you know who I think I am?
I am the ruler of distant lands,
The pharaoh of shifting sands,
I am the richest man to walk the earth,
I've been famous since the day of my birth,
Do you know who I think I am?

Do you know who I am?
I don't rule myself, let alone other men,
I am a prisoner inside my own pen,
Living on pennies a week, just getting by,
And no one will be there to cry when I die.

So ask me the only thing worth a damn,
Do you know who I think I am?

Rapture

A man screaming in the street,
Mindless of the jeers and heat,
They call him crazy, say he's a fool,
Him versus us, the endless duel.

"Repent!" he shouts again and again,
Even when the sun turns into rain,
"You have one last chance to absolve your sin!"
A man without friends, a man without kin.

We've seen this stranger before,
Way back when, in the days of yore.
Hey JC, JC you look strange,
You're weak, poor, homeless and deranged.

Where is the man I read about?
He wouldn't stand on the street and shout,
He was clean, well-spoken and smart,
Not dirty, dumb, sleeping in a shopping cart.

Give me my superstar,
Give me my king,
Give me my messiah,
My reason to sing.

Two thousand years past,
They said the same thing,
The poor carpenter's son,
Was not their mighty king.

The crazy man is now dressed in white,
And he's speaking in a loving tone,
Calling for those who believed him,
And you realize you're all alone.
